title: Please ID
content:
Please help me ID this font — I like it _very_ much :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 7.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113708/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%207_13.png) | 5.38 KB |
author: konsl

comments.content: I think we’re going to need more resolution than that. What is the source? Is it scanned from a book?
You can see the font in action @ [http://www.loricknewyork.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113708/http:/www.loricknewyork.com/ "http://www.loricknewyork.com/")

Damn that’s nice...But i’m not sure what it is either. Thought it might be ITC Founder’s Caslon 12...the italics have a similar slant..but the Roman looks way off..:( But you’re right..it’s very very nice.

The designer responsible uses a collection of great fonts, etc @ [http://www.designedmemory.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091021113708/http:/www.designedmemory.com/ "http://www.designedmemory.com/")

The way it’s represented makes my gut say caslon (letterpressy/old quote)  
—but apparently that’s incorrect? good luck.
